tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

title.native: 夏目友人帳新 ニャンコ先生とはじめてのおつかい
夏目友人帳 伍 特別編

node.description:
[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.

Originating from [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/Satelight).

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [Animator](https://anilist.co/staff/269426/Akiho-Matsui)._
ADR Engineer at FUNimation Entertainment, however has since expanded to also being a Mixing Engineer.

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Jordan Dash Cruz is an American Voice Actor.
